reference.title: Using keys, keyscopes along with branch-filtering
reference.shortdesc: DITA 1.3 introduced Branch filtering and Key scopes. Using both at the same type can be tricky since the DITA Open Toolkit, while implementing the specification, does it in a specific way.

section.title: Branch filtering
section.p: The define Branch filtering as a "mechanism [that] enables map authors to set filtering conditions for specific branches of a map. This makes it possible for multiple conditional-processing profiles to be applied within a single publication."
What it means is you can filter different parts of your maps with different ditaval filter files.
Additionally, the "<ditavalref> element also provides the ability to process a single branch of content multiple times, applying unique conditions to each instance of the branch."
Adding several <ditavalref> under a <topicref> creates an equal number of additional output.
